title: ha ha! now i can see who's on the boards during the weekend!
content: And i thought i was the only one.
author: paul d hunt

comments.content: As if we had real lives… :)
I tend to spend more time on [Typophile](http://web.archive.org/wiki/Typophile) during the weekend… but I guess most people are here when they’re supposed to work. ;)

uhhhh… but now [my boss](http://web.archive.org/wiki/Richard%20Kegler) can keep track of [how i’m spending my time](http://web.archive.org/web/20060512042114/http:/typophile.com/user/7006/track) at work… doh! LOL

i consider typophile part of my job. or rather a way to fully grasp the world of typography and how others think through their own problem solving situations.

eww. that kinda stinks. eheheh.

Tiffany, I think of it the same way. I’ve also mentally prepared a lengthy argument to that effect in case I ever catch flak at work for it.

:)

I think of Typophile as one of the best procrastination techniques ever developed. And I consider procrastination to be an important part of the design process: I get most of my best ideas while I’m procrastinating. It really is much more productive than sitting looking at a blank screen or piece of paper trying to come up with an idea on the spot.
a prolific poster? how embarrasing! LOL
God forbid someone to create something like this to allow my girlfriend to track my way from University to home :)
I’m amazed at the ratio of users to guests.
overall, the new typophile seems a bit voyeuristic. slightly creepy… but i’m not paranoid by it.

Just wait until we install the P22 cam, and everybody can watch your every move! Unless we already have…

Paranoid yet?
only if you put one upstairs in my apartment, too. i don’t want you seein what goes on up there!
